text.p: These are some of the leading stories in the Jordanian press on Wednesday. Reuters has not verified these stories and does not vouch for their accuracy.
- An extraordinary session of parliament for 48 hours to debate the resignation of deputies Amarin and al-Qadi.
- King Hussein starts visit to Bahrain and talks with Sheikh Khalifa tackle bilateral ties and Arab and international issues.
- Crown Prince Hassan says Israeli tunnel excavations in Jerusalem are an "affront to feelings" of Moslems.
- Crown Prince patronises the meeting of religious affairs ministers.
- Employees have a right to a month's end of service payment for every year's employment, says the labour minstry.
- Ad-Dustour publishes the report on the financial crisis of the U.N. Relief and Works Agency for Palestinian refugees (UNRWA).
- Crown Prince Hassan warns Israel against tampering with Jerusalem's holy sites.
- Prime Minister Kabariti says opposition should offer solutions for country's problems instead of attacking government. Premier hints at pardon for detainees in recent unrest.
